title: Pixel Watch 4 To Bring First-Ever New Design, Improved Battery, GPS, and Faster Charging
description: Users will be able to raise their wrist for quick Gemini responses, get personalized help, and receive text suggestions that sound more natural.
content:
Google is expected to unveil the Pixel Watch 4 at its upcoming event with the Pixel 10 series. According to the leaked promo material, Google says the Pixel Watch 4 is “precision crafted” and “performance ready.”

The Pixel Watch 4 is to have a new “Actua 360” display, and could reach up to 3,000 nits peak brightness. The device will come in the same two sizes as the Pixel Watch 3, 41mm and 45mm sizes, but this time with a redesigned look that uses a domed, curved glass face. But it looks fairly similar to its predecessor. Battery life is rated at 30 hours for the 41mm model and 40 hours for the 45mm version, both with always-on display. Google will be adding a new Quick Charge Dock, charging 25% faster than previous Pixel Watch versions.

According to the leak, the Pixel Watch 4 is to have dual-frequency GPS, found on Samsung’s Galaxy Watch 8 and Apple’s Watch Ultra, as reported by 9to5Google. This lets the watch track locations more accurately in urban or crowded settings. The watch has more than forty exercise modes, ECG, SpO2, breathing rate, heart rate variability (HRV), and a Loss of Pulse Detection function.

Gemini will play a central role. As per the promo, users will be able to raise their wrist for quick Gemini responses, get personalized help, and receive text suggestions that sound more natural and less AI. The watch will continue to ship with two years of data on Google Fi Wireless for LTE models.

Overall, if the leaked information is right, the Pixel Watch 4 will add a new screen, charging, and GPS accuracy, while placing Google’s Gemini AI at the center of its user experience. The official announcement is likely to come alongside the Pixel 10 series on August 20, 2025, but there might be a delay in the launch.
summary: Google is expected to unveil the Pixel Watch 4 at its upcoming event with the Pixel 10 series. The device is set to have a new “Actua 360” display, capable of reaching up to 3,000 nits peak brightness, and a new Quick Charge Dock. The watch will also feature dual-frequency GPS, allowing it to track locations more accurately in urban or crowded environments. The official announcement is likely to come alongside the Pixel10 series on August 20, 2025.
shortSummary: Google is expected to unveil the Pixel Watch 4 with improved battery, GPS, and a new Quick Charge Dock, featuring enhanced graphics and AI features.

scraped_sources.text:
The latest Pixel Watch 4 leak reveals how Google will be advertising the 2025 Wear OS 6 device and Gemini plays a big role.
Evan Blass this evening shared marketing material of the upcoming wearable. Just like the phones, it’s now “Google Pixel Watch 4 with Gemini.” The tagline is “Precision crafted. Performance ready.”
Last year’s wearable brought “Actua” from phones to your wrist. The Pixel Watch 4 has an “Actua 360” display with up to 3,000 nits peak brightness. Meanwhile, the new charger is officially called the “Quick Charge Dock” and is 25% faster than before.
Another new Pixel Watch 4 spec from this leak is dual-frequency GPS that allows for a more accurate signal and location tracking especially in busy environments. This matches the Galaxy Watch 8, while the Apple Watch only offers that on the Ultra model.
The specs table also confirms 30 hours (41mm) and 40 hours (45mm) of battery life with the always-on display enabled. The “40+ exercise modes,” ECG, SPO2, breathing, HRV, and Loss of Pulse Detection are unchanged from today.
Google says this is the “watch built for Gemini.” You can “raise your wrist for quick AI assistant responses and personalized help,” while you can “keep the conversation going with AI text suggestions that sound like you.”
Google will continue to offer 2 years of data for the Pixel Watch 4 LTE. This is available through Google FI Wireless for “messaging, navigation, and music on the go.” Calling is not supported.
